{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents describe meningomyelocele as a congenital condition that can manifest externally or internally. The provided options suggest various types of cultures to diagnose the leaky meningomyelocele. Considering the age of the infant, 7 days old, and the description of late-onset meningitis in very-low-birth-weight infants, it is unlikely that blood, urine, or rectal swab-culture would be suitable for diagnosing the condition at this early stage. The option D: Wound swab-culture and sensitivity seems more plausible as a diagnostic test for the leaky meningomyelocele.", "answer_choice": "D"}
